page.title: 05SCHOOLING IN AMPNEY CRUCIS
page.content: There is now no{playgroup.}The { {Ampney Crucis Church of England {Primary School (Aided)}has 48 pupils, 2 full-time teachers, one part-time, a cook, a caretaker, a dinner helper and a secretary. The children come from: Ampney Crucis- 21, Ampney St Mary- 4, Ampney St Peter- 2, Norcot- 2, Driffield- 5,Barnsley- 5, Cirencester- 1. The school has 3 classrooms, a hall, a kitchen, a staffroom, two playing fields and a swimming pool. The children wear a navy, grey and blue school uniform. There are annual funds available to the school from the charity left by Robert Pleydell. The children go to comprehensive school in {Cirencester}or{Fairford}at 11 years of age. At least 14 children in the area go to private schools. College courses are available in{Swindon}and { {Cheltenham. }
